question.body: Why do the accessory muscles of respiration seem to be straining during an asthma attack?

multiple_choice.choice: Because the smooth muscle of the bronchioles has dilated increasing the resistance of airflow into the lungs.
Because the smooth muscle of the bronchioles has constricted increasing the resistance of airflow into the lungs.
Because there is an increase in resistance of the respiratory zone during an asthma attack.
Because there is a decrease in resistance of the conducting zone during an asthma attack.

response.feedback: Incorrect. During an asthma attack the smooth muscle of the bronchioles has constricted which will increase the resistance of airflow into the lungs. Bronchodilators are used to treat this condition.

Correct. During an asthma attack the smooth muscle of the bronchioles has constricted which will increase the resistance of airflow into the lungs. When this happens a person now needs to generate much larger changes in intrapulmonary pressure to maintain a normal flow rate of air during breathing which will require the muscles of respiration to work harder.
Incorrect. During an asthma attack the increase in resistance occurs in the conducting zone of the bronchial tree.
Incorrect. During an asthma attack there is an increase of resistance in the conducting zone as the bronchial tubes constrict.

question.body: Compliance of the lungs is dependant on what two properties of lung tissue?

multiple_choice.choice: The dilation of the smooth muscle tissue and the resistance in the conducting zone.
The constriction of smooth muscle tissue and the accumulation of mucus in the airways.
The constriction of smooth muscle tissue and elasticity of the connective tissue.
Elasticity of the connective tissue and alveolar surface tension.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The property of resistance is dependent on the dilation and constriction of the smooth muscle tissue of the bronchial tubes.
Incorrect. The constriction of smooth muscle tissue and accumulation of mucus will both increase the resistance of the airway.
Incorrect. The constriction of the smooth muscle tissue will increase the the resistance of the air ways not the compliance. The elasticity of the lung tissue will affect the compliance.
Correct. Compliance is going to determine how much effort is required to breathe. Both the elasticity of the connective tissue and the alveolar surface tension are going to play a role in this.
